page.title: Who Do You Think You Are? (U.S. TV series)

revisions.rev:
{{infobox television | show_name = Who Do You Think You Are? | image = | creator = Alex Graham | caption = | starring = | narrated = | genre = [[Documentary film|Documentary]] | country = [[United States]] | network = [[NBC]] | num_seasons = 2 | executive_producer = [[Lisa Kudrow]]
[[Dan Bucatinsky]]
Alex Graham | company = [[Wall to Wall (production company)|Wall to Wall]]
Is Or Isn't Entertainment | runtime = 60 minutes (including commercials) | distributor = | first_aired = {{start date|2010|3|5}} | last_aired = present | num_episodes = 15 | website = http://www.nbc.com/who-do-you-think-you-are/ }} '''''Who Do You Think You Are?''''' is an [[United States of America|American]] [[genealogy]] [[documentary film|documentary]] series that premiered on [[NBC]] on March 5, 2010. The show is an adaptation of the [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Who Do You Think You Are? (British TV series)|series of the same name]], aired by the [[BBC]]. Each week a celebrity goes on a journey to trace his or her [[family tree]]. [[Lisa Kudrow]] is executive producer for the series, which is a partnership between NBC Entertainment and [[Ancestry.com]]. It is produced in association with BBC and Watch. == Episodes == === Season 1 (2010) === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left" |- !Episode !Airdate !Featured celebrity !Locations visited |- |1 |March 5, 2010 |[[Sarah Jessica Parker]] | [[Cincinnati, Ohio]]; [[El Dorado County]], [[California]]; [[Boston, Massachusetts]]; [[Danvers, Massachusetts]] |- |2 |March 12, 2010 |[[Emmitt Smith]] | [[Pensacola, Florida]]; [[Burnt Corn, Alabama]]; [[Claiborne, Alabama]]; [[Boydton, Virginia]]; [[Ouidah]], [[Benin]] |- |3 |March 19, 2010 |[[Lisa Kudrow]] |[[Ilya, Belarus]]; [[Gdynia]], [[Poland]] |- |4 |March 26, 2010 |[[Matthew Broderick]] |[[Jersey City, New Jersey]]; [[New York City, New York]]; forest of [[Argonne]], [[France]]; [[Hartford, Connecticut]]; [[Atlanta, Georgia]]; [[Marietta National Cemetery]], [[Cobb County, Georgia]] |- |5 |April 2, 2010 |[[Brooke Shields]] |[[Newark, New Jersey]]; [[New York City, New York]]; [[Rome, Italy]]; [[Augerolles]], [[France]]; [[Paris, France]] |- |6 |April 23, 2010 |[[Susan Sarandon]] | [[Virginia]]; [[New York City, New York]]; [[Florence]]; [[Coreglia Antelminelli]]; [[Rockland County, New York]] |- |7 |April 30, 2010 |[[Spike Lee]] |[[Atlanta, Georgia]]; [[Twiggs County, Georgia]]; [[Arlington, Texas]] |} === Season 2 (2011) === NBC ordered a second season for the reality series on April 5, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/04/05/nbc-renews-marriage-ref-minute-to-win-it-and-who-do-you-think-you-are/47405|title=NBC renews âMarriage Ref, âMinute To Win It,â and âWho Do You Think You Are?â|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=April 5, 2010|work=TVbytheNumbers|accessdate=April 5, 2010}} The second season of the reality series began on February 4, 2011 and consisted of eight episodes. The first episode featured [[Vanessa L. Williams|Vanessa Williams]]. Following episodes featured [[Tim McGraw]], [[Rosie O'Donnell]], [[Kim Cattrall]], [[Lionel Ritchie]], [[Steve Buscemi]], [[Gwyneth Paltrow]], and [[Ashley Judd]].http://www.docstoc.com/docs/66645447/CW---Primetime-Calender-thru-to-March-4-2011http://www.nbc.com/news/2010/12/16/who-do-you-think-you-are-nbc-announces-the-celebrities-tracing-their-family-trees-on-season-two/http://www.tbs.com/video/conan.jsp?oid=242984http://www.nbcumv.com/mediavillage/networks/nbcentertainment/whodoyouthinkyouare/pressreleases?pr=contents/press-releases/2010/12/16/nbcannouncesthe1292522226088.xml Rather than film another one, Cattrall's episode is an edited version of the original one that she made for the [[Who Do You Think You Are? (British TV series)|British series]] in 2009. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:left" |- !Episode !Airdate !Featured celebrity !Locations visited |- |1 |February 4, 2011 |[[Vanessa L. [[Frankfort, Kentucky]]; [[Saltville, Virginia]]; [[Boston|Boston, Massachusetts]]; [[York|York, England]]; [[Boston, Lincolnshire|Boston, Lincolnshire, England]]; [[Cambridge|Cambridge, England]]; [[Plymouth|Plymouth, Devon, England]] |} === Season 3 (2012) === The show was renewed for a third season by NBC on February 22, 2011, it will air during the 2011-2012 television season. {{cite web|last=NBC|title=NBC Picks Up 'The Biggest Loser,' 'Who Do You Think You Are?' and 'The Sing-Off' For 2011-12|url=http://www.nbc.com/news/2011/02/22/nbc-picks-up-the-biggest-loser-who-do-you-think-you-are-and-the-sing-off-for-2011-12/}} [[Marisa Tomei]], [[Martin Sheen]] and [[Blair Underwood]] will take part in Season 3. http://insidetv.ew.com/2011/10/04/marisa-tomei-meets-the-relatives-in-who-do-you-think-you-are-exclusive/ It was announced on November 14, 2011 that the show will return again in the same timeslot on February 3, 2012. == Ratings == === Season 1: 2010 === {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! # ! The Complete
Second Season | style="text-align: center;" | TBA | style="text-align: center;" | February 20, 2012http://www.amazon.co.uk/Who-Do-You-Think-Are/dp/B00660L4AS/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1321354311&sr=8-3 | style="text-align: center;" | TBA | style="text-align: center;" | TBA | style="text-align: center;" | TBA |} == International distribution == *In [[Australia]], Season 1 began airing on the [[Nine Network]] on April 28, 2010.Channel Nine Australia http://www.fixplay.ninemsn.com.au/whodoyouthinkyouare Season 2 and reruns of Season 1 will now air on sister channel, [[GEM (Australian TV channel)|GEM]]. For a reason unexplained by Nine, the episodes featuring Spike Lee and Emmitt Smith were not aired in the initial Australian screenings. *In the [[Republic of Ireland]], the first season of the US version began airing on [[RTÃ One]] on Thursday, May 27, 2010 at 22:25http://tvsales.rte.ie/programming/week21.htm. The second series premiered on Monday the 4th of July 2011, on [[RTÃ One]] at 22:40.http://www.rte.ie/tv/programmes/who_do_you_think_you_are_usa.html *In the [[United Kingdom]], the first season of the US version began airing on [[BBC One]] on Sunday June 13, 2010 at 21:15, the show received the same voice-over as the UK original series.http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b007t575. The second series, premiered on Wednesday 16 November, 2011 at 22:45. The first episode shown was that following Steve Buscemi. *In [[Sweden]], the first season of the US version began airing with Swedish subtitles on [[Sveriges Television|SVT]] on Tuesday September 14, 2010 at 13:20. *In [[Greece]], the first season of the US version began airing with Greek subtitles on [[Fox Life Greece|Fox Life]] on Thursday October 14, 2010 at 21:55. *In [[Finland]], the first season of the US version began airing with Finnish subtitles on [[MTV3]] on Thursday December 30, 2010 at 20:00 and it's called Sukujuuria etsimÃ¤ssÃ¤, "Looking for family roots". == References == {{Reflist|2}} == External links == *{{official|http://www.nbc.com/who-do-you-think-you-are/}} *{{imdb title|id=1365047|title=Who Do You Think You Are?}} *{{tv.com|76665|Who Do You Think You Are?}} {{Who Do You Think You Are?}} {{NBCNetwork Shows (current and upcoming)}} [[Category:2010 American television series debuts]] [[Category:2010s American television series]] [[Category:American documentary television series]] [[Category:American television series based on British television series]] [[Category:Family history]] [[Category:American genealogy]] [[da:Who Do You Think You Are?
